citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A 5 year old female Bichon (#186) had a significant amount of tartar buildup on the upper molars of the right side of its
mouth. In addition there was a gap between the top of the teeth and its gums (it appears the gums are receding) and
blood was observed during the examination.
Dental issues can be painful and can lead to infection which can become systemic. The dog needs to be examined by the
Attending Veterinarian and treatment must be provided per the Attending Veterinarian's instructions.
Correct by 12/12/24.

The licensee has not had his population of dogs sampled for fecal parasites in the past year. In addition, I did not see any
records that showed his adult dogs were current on their distemper or parvo vaccines. I reviewed three records. When
asked, the licensee stated that most of his dogs are not current on their distemper and parvo vaccinations. In addition, at
least one dog was not current on its rabies vaccine.
Not having the dogs sampled for fecal parasites and not having the entire population vaccinated for distemper, parvo and
rabies doesn't ensure the dogs are adequately protected against the various diseases that dogs can get.
The population of dogs must be sampled for fecal parasites in accordance with the program of the veterinary care. All
dogs that are not current on their distemper, parvo, or rabies vaccines must be vaccinated against those diseases.
Correct by 1/11/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A 5 year old female Bichon (#186) had a significant amount of tartar buildup on the upper molars of the right side of its 
mouth. In addition there was a gap between the top of the teeth and its gums (it appears the gums are receding) and 
blood was observed during the examination. 
 
Dental issues can be painful and can lead to infection which can become systemic. The dog needs to be examined by the 
Attending Veterinarian and treatment must be provided per the Attending Veterinarian's instructions. 
 
Correct by 12/12/24. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee has not had his population of dogs sampled for fecal parasites in the past year. In addition, I did not see any 
records that showed his adult dogs were current on their distemper or parvo vaccines. I reviewed three records. When 
asked, the licensee stated that most of his dogs are not current on their distemper and parvo vaccinations. In addition, at 
least one dog was not current on its rabies vaccine. 
 
Not having the dogs sampled for fecal parasites and not having the entire population vaccinated for distemper, parvo and 
rabies doesn't ensure the dogs are adequately protected against the various diseases that dogs can get. 
 
The population of dogs must be sampled for fecal parasites in accordance with the program of the veterinary care. All 
dogs that are not current on their distemper, parvo, or rabies vaccines must be vaccinated against those diseases. 
 
Correct by 1/11/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report.

n
